And I think that's okay with me because, because of the rest of the stuff.  All the good shit.  All the surprises.  It's a fucking miracle when you come down to it.  We'd have had amazing children, you and me.  We'd have had a ride.  You'd have surprised yourself.  I'll never love anybody else, you know.

Otis doesn't bite. It's just, I really love my dog and he doesn't really bark a lot. We live in a canyon.  We hear dogs barking at night, too.  And it's not Otis.

turns.text: Yeah, well, it's just us and a few hundred of our closest friends.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: I'm not going to leave you alone.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: They're really nice people, Ryan. They're like us...

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I think you need to speak for yourself, Ryan.  But I think you're really nice people...

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Are you making an ass of yourself?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: There's only you, Ryan.  You know what, Ryan?  You're beautiful.  I love you so much... You need...

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You need a good review and you'll be fine.  The whole color of the world will change, mark my words.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm going to go get my swimsuit.  I do know, Ryan, this is non addictive so you mustn't worry.  Ryan, you're a great man.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Ryan, you've got to come!  You've got to help me find the dog!  I let their dog out.  We need to find the dog.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I left the gate open and Otis got out! He could get hit by a car!

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: We have to find the dog, Ryan.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Because we're nice people, and because what goes around comes around.  Because, God help you if something happens to that dog?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: All the ugly phone calls?  We're not the only people with a tape recorder, Ryan.  They've gone to the canyon, we should go towards the PCH.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Jesus Christ, it's a fucking dog!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Are you working on a new book?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Yes, great!  It's a beautiful house.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Thank you.  I understand you're an interior decorator.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Well, whoever did this is amazing.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: There's a goddamn sign on the gate.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You fucking cow, can't you read?!

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: I'm in the same room with Sally Nash.  Oh my God.  You're my icon.  I've been watching your films since I was a little girl.  Like, four years ago I followed you all around the Beverly Center - at least half a day, working up the courage to introduce myself.

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: And I'm overwhelmed.  And I want to do it justice.  And I hope we can spend time together.  And I'm gushing.  It's my worst quality.

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Oh my god.  I've been so rude.  I'm Skye Davidson.  Has anyone ever told you, you look like Peter Sellers?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Oh yes, indeed.  That was my clue, you see.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Otis!!  Shostakovich identified with the Jew.  He felt persecuted, hunted, crushed under the thumb of Stalinist imperialism.

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Not to mention Andrew Zhdanov... Otis, come!!

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Andre Zhdanov?  How the hell do you know about Andre Zhdanov?

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Who doesn't know about the infamous composer's conference of 1948 where Zhdanov persecuted the leaders of Soviet Music - Shostakovich, Prokofieve, and Myaskovsky.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: I'll tell you who doesn't know, cute girls don't know.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Otis you crazy dog!  Otis are you in this God forsaken Canyon?  My people are very hungry.

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: I just did a movie about Bob Yar, I played Gittle, the Jewish milkmaid who gets shot in the head, and they used Shostakovich's 13th Symphony.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Set to the poem of Yetveshenko!

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Exactly!  So I dug it, and I did a lot of research.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Do you really, you really, like Shostakovich?

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: If he were still alive, maybe.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: How about someone who really really liked Shostakovich?

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Are you asking me to marry you?

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: No, I'm just testing to see how deeply perverted and impulsive you are.

turns.speaker: PANES
turns.text: Oh good, I'm worse... Are you really twenty-two?

turns.speaker: SKYE
turns.text: Who told you that?  No.  I'm twenty...  Five.
